definition: any clever maneuver, twist suddenly so as to sprain
details:
noun
- any clever maneuver
= synonyms: device
- the act of rotating rapidly
= synonyms: spin
- turning or twisting around, in place
= example: turning or twisting around, in place
- the act of winding or twisting
= synonyms: winding, wind
- social dancing in which couples vigorously twist their hips and arms in time to the music
- a hairdo formed by braiding or twisting the hair
= synonyms: braid, plait, tress
- an interpretation of a text or action
= synonyms: construction
- a jerky pulling movement
= synonyms: wrench
- an unforeseen development
= synonyms: turn, turn of events
- a miniature whirlpool or whirlwind resulting when the current of a fluid doubles back on itself
= synonyms: eddy
- a circular segment of a curve
= synonyms: turn, bend, crook
- a sharp bend in a line produced when a line having a loop is pulled tight
= synonyms: twirl, kink
- a sharp strain on muscles or ligaments
= synonyms: pull
verb
- twist suddenly so as to sprain
= synonyms: turn, wrench, rick, sprain, wrick
- form into twists
- practice sophistry
= synonyms: convolute, pervert, sophisticate, twist around
- turn in the opposite direction
= example: turn in the opposite direction
- form into a spiral shape
= example: form into a spiral shape
= synonyms: twine, distort
- cause (a plastic object) to assume a crooked or angular form
= synonyms: flex, deform
- twist or pull violently or suddenly, especially so as to remove (something) from that to which it is attached or from where it originates
= synonyms: wrench
- to move in a twisting or contorted motion, (especially when struggling)
= synonyms: wriggle, squirm, wrestle, worm, writhe
- do the twist
- extend in curves and turns
= synonyms: curve
